questions.title: Two Sum (Explain Only)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would find two numbers in an array that add up to a specific target. You may assume exactly one solution.
followups: What is the time complexity difference between the brute force and hash map approaches?
How would you handle duplicate numbers in the array?
What if the array is sorted? Can you optimize further?

questions.title: Reverse a String (In-Place)
questions.prompt: Explain step-by-step how you would reverse a string in-place without using any built-in reverse functions.
followups: What is the space complexity of your approach?
How would you handle Unicode characters?
Can you write the iterative and recursive versions?

questions.title: Palindrome Check
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if a given string reads the same forwards and backwards.
followups: Would you ignore case sensitivity and non-alphanumeric characters?
Why is comparing from both ends more efficient?
What edge cases (empty string, single character) would you test?

questions.title: Find the Largest and Smallest Number
questions.prompt: Explain how you would find both the largest and smallest number in an unsorted array in a single pass.
followups: What is the time complexity?
How many comparisons are needed in the worst case?
What if the array contains negative numbers or is empty?

questions.title: Factorial Without Loops or Recursion
questions.prompt: Is it possible to find the factorial of a given number without using any loop or recursion? If yes, explain how.
followups: Can you use compile-time evaluation (e.g., templates in C++)?
What are the limitations of this approach?
How would you handle large numbers (overflow)?

questions.title: Count Frequency of Elements
questions.prompt: Explain how you would count the frequency of each element in an array.
followups: What data structure provides O(1) average time for insert and lookup?
How would you handle very large input where memory is constrained?
What if the elements are only positive integers in a fixed range?

questions.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array
questions.prompt: Explain how you would remove duplicates from a sorted array in-place and return the new length.
followups: What is the time and space complexity?
How does the algorithm change if the array is unsorted?
Why is the two-pointer approach optimal here?

questions.title: Binary Search (Concept)
questions.prompt: Explain how binary search works on a sorted list and why it is efficient.
followups: What is the time complexity of binary search?
What happens if the list contains duplicates?
How do you avoid integer overflow when calculating the mid-point?

questions.title: Merge Two Sorted Arrays
questions.prompt: Explain how you would merge two sorted arrays into one sorted array.
followups: What is the time and space complexity?
How would you merge them in-place if the first array has enough buffer space?
Can you generalize this to merge K sorted lists?

questions.title: Valid Parentheses
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if a string containing brackets '()', '{}', '[]' is correctly matched and nested.
followups: Why is a stack the appropriate data structure here?
What makes a string invalid?
How would you extend this to support other delimiter pairs?

questions.title: OOP: Class vs Object
questions.prompt: What is the difference between a class and an object? Provide a real-world banking example.
followups: Can you have an object without a class?
What is the memory allocation difference?
Give an example using an 'Account' class.

questions.title: OOP: Four Pillars
questions.prompt: Explain the four pillars of Object-Oriented Programming with real-world examples.
followups: How do you achieve abstraction codewise (abstract classes vs interfaces)?
Why is encapsulation important for data security in banking applications?
Give an example of polymorphism using method overloading and overriding.

questions.title: Overloading vs Overriding
questions.prompt: What is the difference between method overloading and method overriding?
followups: Which one is resolved at compile-time and which at runtime?
Can you override a private method?
What is the @Override annotation used for?

questions.title: Array vs Linked List
questions.prompt: What are the key differences between an array and a linked list?
followups: Which one would you prefer for stack implementation and why?
What are the cache locality implications?
When would you choose a linked list over an array?

questions.title: Stack vs Queue
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between a stack and a queue. Provide real-life examples.
followups: What does LIFO and FIFO mean?
How would you implement a queue using two stacks?
Where is a queue used in operating systems?

questions.title: HashMap Collision Resolution
questions.prompt: Explain how a HashMap handles collisions. What are the different collision resolution strategies?
followups: What is separate chaining vs open addressing?
When does a HashMap convert a linked list to a red-black tree in Java 8+?
What is a good hash function?

questions.title: SQL: Basic Join
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between INNER JOIN and LEFT JOIN using 'Customers' and 'Orders' tables.
followups: What happens to the columns from the right table if there is no match in a LEFT JOIN?
How do you find customers who have never placed an order?
What is a self-join? Can you give an example?

questions.title: Call by Value vs Call by Reference
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between call by value and call by reference. Illustrate using the call stack.
followups: Is Java pass-by-value or pass-by-reference?
How does this affect object references?
Write a code example that demonstrates the difference.

questions.title: Process vs Thread
questions.prompt: What is the difference between a process and a thread?
followups: Which one has more overhead for creation and context switching?
How do threads share memory?
What are the advantages of multi-threading?

questions.title: TCP vs UDP
questions.prompt: What are the key differences between TCP and UDP? When would you use each?
followups: Why does HTTP use TCP?
What is the three-way handshake?
Can you explain the four-way wave and why it needs four steps?

questions.title: Singleton Pattern
questions.prompt: Explain the Singleton design pattern. When and why would you use it?
followups: How do you make a Singleton thread-safe?
What is the Bill Pugh Singleton implementation?
What are the drawbacks of the Singleton pattern?

questions.title: Why Morgan Stanley? (Intern Focus)
questions.prompt: Why do you want to intern at Morgan Stanley? What do you know about the firm?
followups: What do you know about Morgan Stanley's stock or investment banking divisions?
How does Morgan Stanley's technology culture differ from other banks?
Why should we choose you over other candidates?

questions.title: Behavioral: Strengths and Weaknesses
questions.prompt: What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?
followups: Give a specific example of how you've used this strength in a project.
What steps are you taking to improve your weakness?
How do your strengths make you a good fit for this role?

questions.title: Behavioral: Tell Me About Yourself
questions.prompt: Walk me through your resume and tell me about yourself.
followups: Why did you choose your major?
What project are you most proud of?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
